Key Match Events: Lionel Messi scored twice and assisted on another goal in Argentina's 4-1 win over Guatemala.
Messi struck the woodwork with a free kick and contributed to a sequence leading to a penalty kick goal.
Lautaro Martinez also scored twice for Argentina.
Guatemala took a surprise lead in the fourth minute due to an own goal by Lisandro Martinez.
Messi tied the game eight minutes later after an errant pass from Guatemala goalkeeper Nicholas Hagen.
Messi's feed led to a penalty shot for Lautaro Martinez in the 38th minute.
Martinez scored his second goal in the 66th minute after a pass from Messi.
Messi finished the scoring in the 77th minute with a chip over the goalkeeper after a give-and-go with Angel Di Maria.
Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi played his first international start since November.
Messi previously missed a pair of international friendlies in March due to a hamstring issue.
Messi's performance was part of Argentina's preparations for the 2024 Copa America.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Lionel Scaloni mentioned the idea was to look for something different and improve.
Scaloni praised Messi's decision to let Lautaro Martinez take the penalty, highlighting Messi's kindness.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held in Landover, Md.
Argentina is the defending Copa America and World Cup champion.
Guatemala is ranked 108th in FIFA’s world rankings.
